issue.title: ALERT: [ethjs-rpc] rpc error with payload {"id":3601945497860,"jsonrpc":"2.0","params" - Error: invalid sender
issue.body:
Hello,
I have a MetaMask issue in sending a transaction or even tokens between 2 accounts
The error message like the following:

> **ALERT: [ethjs-rpc] rpc error with payload {"id":3601945497860,"jsonrpc":"2.0","params":[""],"method":"eth_sendRawTransaction"} Error: invalid sender**

So i am working on a small project to build a private blockchain using geth eth client, I couldn't export the private key from the accounts created inside my private node so what I did is creating  a new account in MetaMask and import the private key of that account to the list of  accounts in my private blockchain, I was able to execute commands to send transactions (eth or tokens) btw accounts and the result will automatically reflect on MetaMask balances, for example if I send 1 eth from account x to account y by using geth terminal, the transaction will be created and sealed in a newly mined block, and the result will reflect on MetaMask wallets, so everything so far so good, however when I try to use MetaMask to send transaction between account x and account y, it's giving an error that I already mentioned above. can someone help regarding this matter ??

Please note that i used Remix to execute the smart contract (create ERC20 token) on the private blockchain and then i used the contract address to import the tokens into MetaMask account and it works perfectly!!, but sending these tokens or eth directly on MetaMask is the main issue

- Genesis Block:

```
{
  "config": {
    "chainId": 15,
    "homesteadBlock": 0,
    "eip155Block": 0,
    "eip158Block": 0
    
  },
  "difficulty": "0x20000",
  "gasLimit": "0x8000000",
  "alloc": {

	}
  
}

```
- I tried again by matching Networkid with Chainid, but still same error, also i set the EIP to 0 and nothing changed.
- I guess the problem is not related to a smart contract or the version of "pragma solidity" because it didn't work on sending eth as well. 
- MetaMask is well connected to my Private Blockchain via RPC connection on port 8455, again everything I do on geth client terminal reflecting and updating the balances on MetaMask,  but sending direct transactions or tokens between the accounts is the main problem and couldn't solve it even after I tried many solutions here.

comment.body:
Hi, I had the same issue with Metamask 7.7.4
Reinstalling Metamask solved the error.  I was not able to reproduce the error. BUT: Strangely the error occurred only in combination with Ganache and did not occur with the same contract on Ropsten and Rinkeby. Also using the old .json files from server did not solve the error. Maybe this info might help somebody.

issue.title: 100% CPU utilization
issue.body:
Hi,

we've faced an issue when metamask extension together with IdentityServer4's js make Chrome tab to utilize 100% CPU. The reason is in the way metamask extension uses messaging via `window.addEventListener('message', ...)` and `window.postMessage`. 

It looks like the reason is that metamask extension subscribes to all window objects it can find, including IdentityServer's iframe.

Link to the original issue: https://github.com/IdentityServer/IdentityServer4/issues/3238

Is this the intended behavior?

comment.body:
It does seem to get progressively worse over time.  I just disabled, and re-enabled the plugin, and it's ok now.  I know if I leave this PC on overnight, it will be showing up in the task manager again in the morning.

Currently using instadapp.io although I don't think it's app related.

issue.title: 100% CPU utilization
issue.body:
Hi,

we've faced an issue when metamask extension together with IdentityServer4's js make Chrome tab to utilize 100% CPU. The reason is in the way metamask extension uses messaging via `window.addEventListener('message', ...)` and `window.postMessage`. 

It looks like the reason is that metamask extension subscribes to all window objects it can find, including IdentityServer's iframe.

Link to the original issue: https://github.com/IdentityServer/IdentityServer4/issues/3238

Is this the intended behavior?

comment.body:
> I see this in bursts on Chrome/Ubuntu. 

Any extra context about your usage could be helpful. Do you use many dapps? Does the slowness build up over time? Does it happen when you have a particular dapp or wallet open? Any favorite dapps could possibly help, too.

issue.title: 100% CPU utilization
issue.body:
Hi,

we've faced an issue when metamask extension together with IdentityServer4's js make Chrome tab to utilize 100% CPU. The reason is in the way metamask extension uses messaging via `window.addEventListener('message', ...)` and `window.postMessage`. 

It looks like the reason is that metamask extension subscribes to all window objects it can find, including IdentityServer's iframe.

Link to the original issue: https://github.com/IdentityServer/IdentityServer4/issues/3238

Is this the intended behavior?

comment.body: I see this in bursts on Chrome/Ubuntu.  100% CPU on one core for up to 16 seconds at a time.  I typically have a lot of tabs open (about 100 at the moment, across several screens).  It makes the whole Chrome UI laggy, so when i'm not using Metamask, I disable it.  As i type this now, sometimes the characters take a while to catch up.

Instead https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/7247

+import Identicon from '../../components/ui/identicon'

+import { conversionUtil } from '../../helpers/utils/conversion-util'
+import Button from '../../components/ui/button'
+import { DEFAULT_ROUTE } from '../../helpers/constants/routes'
+
+export default class ConfirmDecryptMessage extends Component {
+  static contextTypes = {
+    t: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+    metricsEvent: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+  }
+
+  static propTypes = {
+    balance: PropTypes.string,
+    clearConfirmTransaction: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+    cancelDecryptMessage: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+    decryptMessage: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+    decryptMessageInline: PropTypes.func.isRequired,
+    conversionRate: PropTypes.number,
+    history: PropTypes.object.isRequired,
+    requesterAddress: PropTypes.string,
+    selectedAccount: PropTypes.object,
+    txData: PropTypes.object,
+    domainMetadata: PropTypes.object,
+  }
+
+  state = {
+    selectedAccount: this.props.selectedAccount,
+    hasCopied: false,
+    copyToClipboardPressed: false,
+  }
+
+  componentDidMount = () => {
+    if (getEnvironmentType(window.location.href) === ENVIRONMENT_TYPE_NOTIFICATION) {
+      window.addEventListener('beforeunload', this._beforeUnload)
+    }
+  }
+
+  componentWillUnmount = () => {
+    this._removeBeforeUnload()
+  }
+
+  _beforeUnload = (event) => {
+    const { clearConfirmTransaction, cancelDecryptMessage } = this.props
+    const { metricsEvent } = this.context
+    metricsEvent({
+      eventOpts: {
+        category: 'Transactions',
+        action: 'Decrypt Message Request',
+        name: 'Cancel Decrypt Message Request Via Notification Close',
comment.body:
```suggestion
        name: 'Cancel Via Notification Close',
```

pull_request.body:

  - [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-errors/pull/5
  - [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-inpage-provider/pull/19

Also, this solves `web3@1.x` compatibility issues that broke certain dapps on `develop`.

This `txHelper` function only counts the unapproved transactions for the current network - that's why the network is passed in. The changes made here aren't affected by the network. The same goes for the other types of signing.

pull_request.title: Unstoppable domain resolution
pull_request.body:
Implemented .zil naming resolution using the namicorn library that supports both .eth and .zil names:
* Replaced existing ens library calls with namicorn
* Renamed classes and methods to be abstract from the naming service used

issue.title: Unstoppable domain resolution
issue.body:
Implemented .zil naming resolution using the namicorn library that supports both .eth and .zil names:
* Replaced existing ens library calls with namicorn
* Renamed classes and methods to be abstract from the naming service used

comment.body:
Hey, @JohnnyJumper and @bogdan (and the rest of the UD team) thanks for taking the time to work on this. I know that our teams have communicated about this integration—ultimately this isn't something we want to merge right now. We are happy with the feature-set of ENS right now and are looking to expand our support for it. There's definitely space to reconsider this integration in the future (possibly via a MetaMask Snap?) but I don't want to leave this open to collect merge conflicts in the meantime.

The Snaps route might make more sense as MetaMask could prompt the user to install that Snap if it detects an UD address. This is sometime to explore in the future.
